U.S. SEC Messed Up in Handling Contentious Crypto Accounting Bulletin: GAO https://www.coindesk.com/policy/2023/10/31/us-sec-messed-up-in-handling-contentious-crypto-accounting-bulletin-gao/?utm_medium=referral&utm_source=rss&utm_campaign=headlines WLQBMMOREVB5DAOB32V4T2DQDI Jesse HamiltonThe U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) was out of bounds when it issued its controversial "Staff Accounting Bulletin 121," according to the Government Accountability Office (GAO). The 2022 guidance, which the industry says threatens crypto investors' ability to find safe harbors for their assets, should have been treated as a formal rule, the GAO concluded in a report issued on Tuesday. Tue, 31 Oct 2023 19:11:13 +0000 2023-10-31T19:38:20.518+00:00 PolicynewsRegulationsAccountingSecurities and Exchange CommissionGovernment Accountability OfficeRulemakingCongressChair Gary Gensler's U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has insisted that its accounting policies for crypto didn't need to be treated as a formal rule, but the Government Accountability Office disagrees. (Jesse Hamilton/CoinDesk)杰西·汉密尔顿
